intro: Quercus aliena var. acuticarpa, commonly known as the sharp-fruited oak, is a deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its acorn-like fruits, which are typically elongated and have a pointed tip. The leaves are generally oblong with a serrated margin and can vary in color from dark green to a coppery hue in autumn. This species thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soils and is often found in mixed forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
